intro: Leucas malabarica, commonly known as Malabar leucas, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves that are often grayish-green in color. Its flowers are typically pale blue or purple and are clustered in whorls along the stem. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas.
